page.title: 03Hineswood Farm
page.content: Hineswood Farm is owned by Mr and Mrs Birtles.The present buildings are about 160 years old.Mr Birtles showed us a much older building,now derelict that was hundreds of years old.They have lived on the farm for 36 years. They own 72 acres.No crops are grown on the farm.The land around the farm is described by Mr Birtles as stoney. It is quite hilly and much of the soil is clay.Mr Birtles uses fertilizers but not pesticides that harm wildlife. He enjoys wildlife and has reserved 15 acres to encourage animals and birds. He has seen pheasants,foxes and woodpeckers and has a badger set which he keeps secret.He keeps dead trees for woodpeckers to nest in.Owls are provided with a nest box.Mr nd Mrs Birtles will not allow the Hunt on their property.
